dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, I see a lot of people, uh, myself included sometimes, just jump from one project to the next. Like, you're so excited for the new thing, you kinda forget the old one, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, I see a lot of people, uh, myself included sometimes, just jump from one project to the next. Like, you're so excited for the new thing, you kinda forget the old one, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! I totally do that. You're so focused on the *next* big idea that the last one just... [overlaps] kinda fades away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! I totally do that. You're so focused on the next big idea that the last one just... kinda fades away.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But that can actually really drag down your *new* projects, which is kind of counterintuitive. You end up with all these loose ends.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But that can actually really drag down your new projects, which is kind of counterintuitive. You end up with all these loose ends.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, projects that are not completed with strategic considerations and planning in mind may drag down new projects in many different ways.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. So, like, what do we do about it? How do we actually, um, close things properly without them becoming a burden?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. So, like, what do we do about it? How do we actually, um, close things properly without them becoming a burden?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article talks about six steps for effectively closing projects. The first one is just so simple: make a final checklist.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article talks about six steps for effectively closing projects. The first one is just so simple: make a final checklist.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are six of the steps you can follow to close your projects effectively. Preparing a checklist for your work

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A checklist! I mean, it makes sense. Like, Murphy's Law, right? Anything that can go wrong...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A checklist! I mean, it makes sense. Like, Murphy's Law, right? Anything that can go wrong...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Murphys law states, Anything that can go wrong will go wrong! In order to avoid a train of challenges arriving during the last stage of your project, it is important to develop a final checklist.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, tie up all the loose ends. And they suggest this really cool "3-W approach" for your checklist: What were the main objectives, Where were the challenges, and When did you hit your benchmarks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, tie up all the loose ends. And they suggest this really cool three-W approach for your checklist: What were the main objectives, Where were the challenges, and When did you hit your benchmarks?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 3-W approach can be very helpful for working on your checklist, as you list the three major W-questions: What [what the most strategically important objectives of the project were and what you achieved to address these], Where [where were the most pressing challenges and if you addressed all of them], and When [when you should achieve your major benchmarks in working on your project and if you realized all your deliverables].

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's smart. So it's not just tasks, but a proper review. And then, uh, you also need to make sure everyone *knows* it's closed, right? Like, identifying your target audience?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's smart. So it's not just tasks, but a proper review. And then, uh, you also need to make sure everyone knows it's closed, right? Like, identifying your target audience?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Identifying your target audience It is not enough that you and your team members know about ending the project and delivering the final product... it is imperative that all your partners, clients, stakeholders, investors and supporters know about the successful closure of the project and about your achievements along the way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! That's step two. You do *not* want an angry customer or, uh, especially an investor, popping up later because they weren't informed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! That's step two. You do not want an angry customer or, uh, especially an investor, popping up later because they weren't informed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nobody wants an angry customer or especially an investor to pop up at the last moment, unaware that you have already closed the project but forgot to inform her/him and thus technically did not complete all requirements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, definitely not. Nobody wants that phone call. So that leads into step three, which is, um, developing your communication strategy and choosing your tools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, definitely not. Nobody wants that phone call. So that leads into step three, which is, um, developing your communication strategy and choosing your tools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Developing your communication strategy and choosing communication tools

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. How are you gonna tell people? And what tools are you gonna use so your message doesn't get lost among all the other noise out there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. How are you gonna tell people? And what tools are you gonna use so your message doesn't get lost among all the other noise out there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the information century, it is essential that your message about your project and your projects product(s) dont get lost among other messages, press releases and presentations. Therefore, you should choose your communication strategy and communication tools wisely

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, 'cause there's so much noise. And then, like, you've got to *report* your project, especially B2B.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, 'cause there's so much noise. And then, like, you've got to report your project, especially B2B.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, personally presenting those main achievements to partners and clients. Even though we're in the digital age, those traditional, uh, presentations still matter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, personally presenting those main achievements to partners and clients. Even though we're in the digital age, those traditional, uh, presentations still matter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Effective project managers always personally present the main achievements of their completed project to all their current and potential partners and clients in a public event or even a series of public events. Paradoxically, the old traditional ways of B2B personalized presentations or lately even online B2B presentations have not gone out of fashion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They really do! And speaking of digital, step five is all about presenting your project in cyberspace. Like, getting your project out there online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They really do! And speaking of digital, step five is all about presenting your project in cyberspace. Like, getting your project out there online.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Presenting your project in cyberspace As more and more people search for and find information online, it is essential to identify proper databases, apps, websites or other platforms to present and store the outcomes of your projects in cyberspace.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. LinkedIn, ResearchGate, whatever. Make sure it's stored and accessible for future reference, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. LinkedIn, ResearchGate, whatever. Make sure it's stored and accessible for future reference, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently cyberspace offers many opportunities from professionally run databases and data banks related to different fields to personal professional pages (e.g., LinkedIn, ResearchGate, etc.) where you can store information, reports and research data about past and present projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And finally, uh, the post-project evaluation. Like, what went well, what didn't... and celebrate it! Even with challenges, focus on the bright side.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And finally, uh, the post-project evaluation. Like, what went well, what didn't... and celebrate it! Even with challenges, focus on the bright side.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Conducting post-project evaluation and linking to life after the project Every textbook on project management highlights the importance of post-mortem evaluations. ... it is important to formally and publicly close your project by celebrating with a grand party or a formal workshop. ... even if your project faced many challenges and problems you should focus on the bright side of your experience in the project

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, celebrate the wins, learn from the challenges, and then, um, use that energy to strategically transition to the next big thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, celebrate the wins, learn from the challenges, and then, um, use that energy to strategically transition to the next big thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, even if your project faced many challenges and problems you should focus on the bright side of your experience in the project, creating links to life after this project or transitioning to the next ones.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Love it. So it's not just ending, it's setting yourself up for future success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Love it. So it's not just ending, it's setting yourself up for future success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's, like, a strategic off-ramp for your projects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's, like, a strategic off-ramp for your projects.
